Welcome to the Loyola University Chicago online application system. There are many ways to utilize this system, so please do follow the appropriate steps based on your intentions.
1. If you are starting the application process, please click below on the link entitled "Start New Application" and select the appropriate student type and term.

2. If you are a returning user looking to update and/or complete a current application started previously, please locate the appropriate application in your list of applications and proceed accordingly. Finalize your application by clicking 'Submit'.

3. If you are a returning user and admitted to Loyola for an upcoming term, please log into the admitted student page at LUC.edu/undergrad/status. Here, updates appear regularly on topics like financial aid, residence life, campus visit programs, enrollment deposits, orientation and more.
Loyola University Chicago · 1032 W. Sheridan Rd., Chicago, IL 60660 · 800.262.2373 ·

It’s the “city that works,” and Loyolans keep that work ethic going. We call ourselves Chicago’s leaders, neighbors, and game-changers.
Since its founding in 1870, Loyola has called Chicago home. Each student, alum, and faculty and staff member plays a role in shaping our city—through leadership, service, research, and more.

Since its founding in 1870, Loyola University Chicago has called Chicago home. Each student, alum, and faculty and staff member plays a role in shaping our city—through leadership, service, research, and more.

Executives from across the city gathered at the Baumhart Center’s Good Business Breakfast this fall to discuss the social impact being pioneered by Chicago businesses. Find out what top business leaders had to say about their contributions to a renaissance in the city's neighborhoods and what steps businesses can take to make it happen.

Across the country, the climate crisis has mobilized young people to action, a dynamic that will be the focus of this year’s Climate Change Conference. Hosted by the Institute of Environmental Sustainability, the two-day event will feature a keynote conversation with youth climate leaders moderated by WBEZ's Jerome McDonnell.

Choosing a college is difficult. Applying to one shouldn’t be. At Loyola, we do everything we can to guide you through the admission process—which gives you one less thing to worry about.
Take a visit to Loyola's Lake Shore Campus.

Sure, college is about learning. But it’s also about challenging yourself and discovering new things. It’s about meeting people who have different perspectives and viewpoints. In short, it’s about becoming transformed. At Loyola, you’ll have a chance to do that—and so much more.
Loyola offers nearly 100 master’s degrees and dozens of doctoral programs. Plus our professional schools for business, law, and medicine are routinely ranked among the best in the nation.
Completing your bachelor’s degree will give you a competitive edge in today’s workforce. Our School of Continuing and Professional Studies has flexible programs for working adults.
Advance your career by taking an Executive Education course at Loyola’s Quinlan School of Business. We also offer custom training for organizations looking to improve how they work.

Your college education is one of the most important investments you will ever make. Our Financial Aid Office is available to work with you throughout the admission process to help make your dream of a Loyola education a reality.
